intro: Arctotis trifurcata, commonly known as the three-branched arctotis, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble daisies. The plant typically grows to a height of 30 to 60 centimeters and features lance-shaped leaves with a rough texture. Its flowers are usually pink to purple in color, with yellow centers, and bloom during the warmer months. Arctotis trifurcata is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and as a cut flower.
